File Bash Documentation¶

File Bash is a simple command line interface application developed and maintained in The Python Programming Language. Inspired by the Linux Terminal and the Windows Powershell, File Bash tries to frame the basic commands of a command prompt coded completely in python. The project is not intended to be deployed for public use but for a better practise of python and project management.

Source Code¶

  • Source Code: https://github.com/Sannidhya127/FIle-Bash

Installation¶

Important

The File Bash Installation Wizard is under development and is expected in an ETA of 3-4 months (might change). We appreciate your patience and cooperation.

Support Me¶

If you found File Bash an interesting project, it would be worth a million blessings for me if you oblige to follow me on GitHub at github.com/Sannidhya127 and if possible, propose an idea in the form of pull request in the repository. Refer to Contribute for details on pull requests.

    • 1. ls (List Directory items)
    • 2. rm (Remove Item)

    • 5. crd (Create Directory)
    • 6. cd (Current Directory/Change Directory)
    • 7. sys –info (System Information Printer)
    • 8. sr (Search Directory)
    • 9. delf (Deletes only files)
    • 10. deld (Delete Directory)
    • 11. bash –sys 0 (shutdown system)
    • 12. process –uid (lists running process)
    • 13. hide (hides any item)
    • 14 uhd (unhide)
    • 15. read (prints file content)
    • 16. write (write to a file)
    • 17. rm -rf (Delete a git repository)
    • 18. help (Use your brain)
    • 19. Git and python commands (selective)
    • 20. exit (Exits bash)
